name: 討論與辯論（二）
goals: Acquire the knowledge of different debate propositions and the ability to word a debate proposition properly.
Learn about the format and structure for cross-examination debate.
Acquire the knowledge of affirmative and negative case strategies.
Acquire the skills to ask and respond to questions during cross-examination.
Apply the knowledge and skills concerning critical thinking and argumentative discourse to making and responding to arguments in English.
Learn the importance and essential skills of teamwork.
Learn about different types of formal discussion.
10.　Acquire the knowledge of dynamics of small-group discussion.
11.　Learn the skills entailed in being a good discussant.
12.　Learn the skills entailed in being a competent moderator.
13.　Acquire the ability to evaluate the discussant’s and the moderator’s performances as well as the discussion as a whole.
syllabus:
_Course Description_

This course is designed to help students build skills in discussion and leading discussion sessions in the English language. The course will revolve around a variety of topical issues or trends emerging in the glocal community. Students will learn 1) to uncover political, sociological, economic, technological, or cultural trends or issues for class discussion, especially those which have a solid basis in their own interests or specialties; 2) to do quality research on the topics, and to trim and organize research materials in ways that make the topics presentable, understandable and intriguing; 3) to formulate the questions at issue, lead or facilitate a discussion session, and give directions or guidance in a small peer-group; 4) to give _considered_ responses, to express thoughts and opinions based upon their own observation and study. The course aims to create students’ awareness of the world and its cultures, expand the horizon of their knowledge and in a way prepare them for the job market, advanced studies or simply a better life.

_Texts_

The follows shall provide a reservoir of materials that give students inspiration in considering topics they want to engage with:

a.         _Asian Wall Street Journal_, _Newsweek_, _Time_

current or back issues dated within the last 24 months

b.          [www.variety.com](http://www.variety.com)

c.           any journal suggested by students

2.          Miscellaneous materials handed out by discussion leaders or the instructor.

_Format_

The class will be divided into 4 groups. Each session usually involves two groups. Group A will start a new topic by a) introducing key concepts and basic vocabulary related to the topic, b) handing out preliminary research materials (no more than 12 pages in total) and call attention to passages which the group believes as essential to the understanding of the topic c) giving questions to be dealt with in the following session. In the following week, Group A will lead the discussion with the expectation that the whole class has familiarized themselves with the vocabulary, digested the materials, and thought about the questions and come up with answers or more questions of their own. When a topic is wrapped up by group A in one session, in the following week, group B will give a 10 to 15-min. presentation: 1) summarizing and recapitulating the discussed points in an organized and economic way 2) and giving critique, compliment, or suggestions to ways group A could have improved in presenting/organizing materials or leading discussion. After this short presentation, group B will _at the same time_ submit a typed-up manuscript upon which their critique is based. In the same session, a third group will start a new topic and give an introduction. All groups have to serve both as A and B for at least one time this semester. All groups will have to let me know their topic by the end of the 4th week. Group 2, 3, or 4 must do a Taiwan or Chinese-language film related topic.

_Grading Policy_

the final debate will account for 15% of your total grade

attendance and _manners_ for 15%

performance as a member of group A in presentation: 20%

performance as a member of group A in leading a discussion group: 25%

performance as a member of group B: 8%

performance as a peer-discussant (non-group A): 17%.

_Requirements_

1.  Attendance at all sessions is mandatory.

2.  You receive _a hefty penalty or even failing grade_ if

        you eat in class

you have 5 or more unexcused absences

you or your electronic device, in any way, causes disturbance or interruption in class

        you commit _plagiarism_ of any form

3.  Limit on-line references to _2/3_ of your research materials.
